Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: The primary ID of the asset of this asset depreciation schedule. The value of this field and the asset book reference represent a unique ID that can be used to identify this asset depreciation schedule instance

validation.validation: Asset ID does not exist in the system
There is a pending event for the asset that should be completed before this asset transaction can be processed.
validation.description: There is a pending event for the asset that should be completed before this asset transaction can be processed.

validation.validation: Cannot update asset depreciation schedule information for assets with status of Disposed or assets with acquisition method of Intercompany Transfer
validation.description: Cannot update asset depreciation schedule information for assets with status of Disposed or assets with acquisition method of Intercompany Transfer

validation.validation: Cannot update asset depreciation schedule information for assets with status of Removed
validation.description: Cannot update asset depreciation schedule information for assets with status of Removed

validation.validation: There must be a complete supplier contract amendment for the asset before Workday can process this asset transaction.

Asset_BookObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Asset_BookObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Asset_BookObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: This is the reference id value to an asset book used by the asset company. A value is required for every asset depreciation schedule. The value of this book cannot be the primary book for the asset company.

validation.validation: Asset Book is not valid for the asset Id

You can’t update a depreciation schedule if the schedule contains depreciation lines with Accounted Status. To update depreciation schedules with Accounted Status lines, use the Override Depreciation Period Status task to override the status.
You can't update asset books with posted depreciation.

Accounting_TreatmentObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Accounting_TreatmentObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Accounting_TreatmentObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: This is the reference id value to an existing accounting treatment. Workday supplies the accounting treatments Expense, Depreciable Capital and Non-Depreciable Capital. It is required for every asset depreciation schedule.

validation.validation: Select a valid accounting treatment. The Inventory Asset accounting treatment isn’t valid for assets.

Depreciation_ProfileObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Depreciation_ProfileObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Depreciation_ProfileObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: Reference to depreciation profile used by this asset depreciation schedule. It is required of the accounting treatment is depreciable capital.

validation.validation: Depreciation Profile is required when accounting treatment is Depreciable Capital
validation.description: Depreciation Profile is required when accounting treatment is Depreciable Capital

validation.validation: Depreciation profile must be blank when accounting treatment is not depreciable capital
validation.description: Depreciation profile must be blank when accounting treatment is not depreciable capital

validation.validation: Contract start date and contract end date are required for selected depreciation method.

Depreciation_ConventionObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Depreciation_ConventionObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Depreciation_ConventionObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: Reference to depreciation convention used by this asset depreciation schedule. It is required if the accounting treatment is depreciable capital.In order to assign 'Half-Year' as the depreciation convention, the company asset book must use a fiscal schedule with an even number of fiscal periods per fiscal year.In order to assign 'Mid-Quarter' as the depreciation convention, the company asset book must use a fiscal schedule where number of fiscal periods per fiscal year is divisible by 4.

validation.validation: Depreciation convention must be blank when accounting treatment is not depreciable capital
validation.description: Depreciation convention must be blank when accounting treatment is not depreciable capital

validation.validation: Depreciation Convention is required when accounting treatment is depreciable capital
validation.description: Depreciation Convention is required when accounting treatment is depreciable capital

Abstract_Depreciation_MethodObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Abstract_Depreciation_MethodObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Abstract_Depreciation_MethodObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: Reference to depreciation method used by this asset depreciation schedule. It is required if the accounting treatment is depreciable capital

validation.validation: Depreciation Method is required when accounting treatment is Depreciable Capital
validation.description: Depreciation Method is required when accounting treatment is Depreciable Capital

validation.validation: Depreciation method must be blank when accounting treatment is not depreciable capital
validation.description: Depreciation method must be blank when accounting treatment is not depreciable capital

validation.validation: The selected Depreciation Convention can't be used with a depreciation method of [Depreciation Method].

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: Numeric value representing the depreciation percent for Declining Balance with Switch to Straight Line method. It is required when the depreciation method is declining balance. It left blank, it will be defaulted from the depreciation profile.

validation.validation: Depreciation percent must be zero unless you are using Declining Balance or Declining Balance Switch to Straight Line Depreciation Methods.
validation.description: Depreciation percent must be zero unless you are using Declining Balance or Declining Balance Switch to Straight Line Depreciation Methods.

validation.validation: Depreciation percent should be greater than 100 when the depreciation method is Declining Balance Switch to SL.
validation.description: Depreciation percent should be greater than 100 when the depreciation method is Declining Balance Switch to SL.

validation.validation: Depreciation percent must be greater than 0 and less than 100 when the depreciation method is Declining Balance.
validation.description: Depreciation percent must be greater than 0 and less than 100 when the depreciation method is Declining Balance.

validation.validation: Enter Depreciation Percent when overriding depreciation profile information and depreciation method is Declining Balance (with and without switch to Straight Line).
validation.description: Enter Depreciation Percent when overriding depreciation profile information and depreciation method is Declining Balance (with and without switch to Straight Line).

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: Numeric value representing the useful life (in periods) for the asset depreciation schedule. It is required if the accounting treatment is depreciable capital. If left blank it will be defaulted from the depreciation profile.

validation.validation: Useful Life cannot be more than 200 years. Useful life in years is useful life in periods divided by number of periods in the company's fiscal year.
validation.description: Useful Life cannot be more than 200 years. Useful life in years is useful life in periods divided by number of periods in the company's fiscal year.

validation.validation: Useful life in periods must be 0 when accounting treatment is expense
Useful Life must be equal to zero if the Depreciation Method is Declining Balance.
validation.description: Useful Life must be equal to zero if the Depreciation Method is Declining Balance.

validation.validation: Useful life in periods is required when accounting treatment is depreciable capital (and depreciation method is not Declining Balance or Term).
You can't enter the Useful Life for an asset with a depreciation method of Term because the Useful Life is derived from the contract start and end dates.

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: Depreciation Threshold. Enter only if method is declining balance.

validation.validation: Only Declining Balance Depreciation Method can have a threshold.
validation.description: Only Declining Balance Depreciation Method can have a threshold.

validation.validation: Declining Balance Depreciation Method must have a threshold.
validation.description: Declining Balance Depreciation Method must have a threshold.

validation.validation: Depreciation Threshold is greater than Total Asset Cost.
validation.description: Depreciation Threshold is greater than Total Asset Cost.

validation.validation: Depreciation Threshold is less than Total Asset Cost.
Depreciation Threshold cannot be positive.
Depreciation Threshold cannot be negative.

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: Workday uses these dates to update External Contract Start and End date if you manually register the asset but updates the In service Start and End date for all other sources.

validation.validation: Contract start date must have same value as Date Acquired
You cannot update the contract start or contract end date for assets that are from a supplier contract.

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: Workday uses these dates to update External Contract Start and End date if you manually register the asset but updates the In service Start and End date for all other sources.

validation.validation: Contract End Date cannot be before the date an asset is acquired.
Contract End Date cannot be before the Contract Start Date.

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: Date value representing the date this asset depreciation schedule is placed in service. It is required if the depreciation schedule has historical information. It cannot be after depreciation start date and prior to the asset acquisition date.

validation.validation: Date placed in service must be blank when accounting treatment is not depreciable capital
validation.description: Date placed in service must be blank when accounting treatment is not depreciable capital

validation.validation: Date placed in service must be the same as asset acquisition date or must be left blank when Place in Service option is Upon Acquisition
validation.description: Date placed in service must be the same as asset acquisition date or must be left blank when Place in Service option is Upon Acquisition

validation.validation: Date placed in service cannot be after the date the asset first issued.
validation.description: Date placed in service cannot be after the date the asset first issued.

validation.validation: Date placed in service cannot be after depreciation start date
validation.description: Date placed in service cannot be after depreciation start date

validation.validation: Date placed in service cannot be prior to date acquired
validation.description: Date placed in service cannot be prior to date acquired

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: Numeric value representing bonus depreciation percent for this asset depreciation schedule. Value cannot be more than 100.

validation.validation: Bonus depreciation percent is required when historical bonus depreciation amount is not 0
Bonus depreciation percent must be 0 when accounting treatment is not depreciable capital
validation.description: Bonus depreciation percent must be 0 when accounting treatment is not depreciable capital

validation.validation: Bonus depreciation percent cannot be more than 100
validation.description: Bonus depreciation percent cannot be more than 100

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: Numeric value representing the maximum bonus depreciation basis. Workday would use the lesser of this field and asset cost that is applicable to bonus depreciation to calculated the bonus amount.

validation.validation: Max Depreciable Basis must be 0 when accounting treatment is not depreciable capital
validation.description: Max Depreciable Basis must be 0 when accounting treatment is not depreciable capital

validation.validation: The max bonus depreciable basis entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point
validation.description: The max bonus depreciable basis entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: For converted assets, the depreciation start date represents the date that depreciation starts in Workday. For converted assets with historical accumulated depreciation, the depreciation start date should be 1 day greater than the date up to which the historical accumulated depreciation is calculated. The date cannot be prior to the acquisition date. For converted assets with no historical accumulated depreciation, leave the depreciation start date blank so that Workday can determine the correct date.

validation.validation: Depreciation Start Date cannot be prior to acquisition date of the asset
validation.description: Depreciation Start Date cannot be prior to acquisition date of the asset

validation.validation: Fiscal period must exist in fiscal schedule for depreciation start date
validation.description: Fiscal period must exist in fiscal schedule for depreciation start date

validation.validation: Depreciation Start Date must match start date of the first fiscal period that depreciation is to start in Workday.
validation.description: Depreciation Start Date must match start date of the first fiscal period that depreciation is to start in Workday.

validation.validation: Depreciation start date must be blank when accounting treatment is not depreciable capital
validation.description: Depreciation start date must be blank when accounting treatment is not depreciable capital

validation.validation: You cannot update depreciation schedule historical information if the schedule was created by Intercompany Transfer transaction
validation.description: You cannot update depreciation schedule historical information if the schedule was created by Intercompany Transfer transaction

validation.validation: Depreciation start date cannot be prior to the effective transaction date of an adjustment if the remaining depreciation periods is 0
validation.description: Depreciation start date cannot be prior to the effective transaction date of an adjustment if the remaining depreciation periods is 0

validation.validation: Depreciation Start Date cannot be prior to the date the asset was transferred to this company
validation.description: Depreciation Start Date cannot be prior to the date the asset was transferred to this company

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: Numeric value for remaining depreciation periods if entering accumulated depreciation from a prior system and depreciation start date. Workday will generate depreciation entries for this schedule for the number of remaining periods.

validation.validation: Remaining depreciation periods is required when you enter Accumulated Depreciation
validation.description: Remaining depreciation periods is required when you enter Accumulated Depreciation

validation.validation: Remaining depreciation periods must be 0 when depreciation start date is blank
validation.description: Remaining depreciation periods must be 0 when depreciation start date is blank

validation.validation: Remaining depreciation periods cannot be greater than useful life
validation.description: Remaining depreciation periods cannot be greater than useful life

validation.validation: When depreciation is based on the number of days per period, all the fiscal years / periods for an asset's useful life must already be created in order to calculate the depreciation amount for each period correctly.   In order to complete the depreciation setup for this asset and create the depreciation schedule, you will need to create additional fiscal years / periods for fiscal schedule linked to the company asset book(s).
validation.description: When depreciation is based on the number of days per period, all the fiscal years / periods for an asset's useful life must already be created in order to calculate the depreciation amount for each period correctly.   In order to complete the depreciation setup for this asset and create the depreciation schedule, you will need to create additional fiscal years / periods for fiscal schedule linked to the company asset book(s).

validation.validation: When depreciation is based on the number of days per period, all the fiscal years / periods for an asset's useful life must already be created in order to calculate the depreciation amount for each period correctly.   In order to complete the depreciation setup for this asset and create the depreciation schedule, you will need to create additional fiscal years / periods for fiscal schedule linked to the company asset book(s).
validation.description: When depreciation is based on the number of days per period, all the fiscal years / periods for an asset's useful life must already be created in order to calculate the depreciation amount for each period correctly.   In order to complete the depreciation setup for this asset and create the depreciation schedule, you will need to create additional fiscal years / periods for fiscal schedule linked to the company asset book(s).

validation.validation: The fiscal period must exist for the depreciation start date in the fiscal schedule for the company asset book.
validation.description: The fiscal period must exist for the depreciation start date in the fiscal schedule for the company asset book.

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: Numeric value representing historical accumulated depreciation as of a day prior to depreciation start date. This value cannot be greater than historical cost minus historical residual value. Workday uses this accumulated depreciation value to determine depreciable cost basis to generate the depreciation schedule for remaining useful life starting from depreciation start date.

validation.validation: Accumulated depreciation cannot be greater than cost minus residual value for the asset book
validation.description: Accumulated depreciation cannot be greater than cost minus residual value for the asset book

validation.validation: Accumulated depreciation must be 0 when depreciation start date is blank
validation.description: Accumulated depreciation must be 0 when depreciation start date is blank

validation.validation: Accumulated depreciation is required when depreciation start date has a value
validation.description: Accumulated depreciation is required when depreciation start date has a value

validation.validation: The accumulated depreciation entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point
validation.description: The accumulated depreciation entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point

validation.validation: Accumulated depreciation cannot be less than cost minus residual value for the asset book.

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: Numeric value representing year-to-date depreciation as of a day period to depreciation start date. This field is required if the asset depreciation schedule has historical information and the depreciation method is either declining balance or sum of years digits. The value of this field cannot be greater than historical accumulated depreciation.

validation.validation: Year to date depreciation is required if depreciation method is Declining Balance with Switch to Straight Line or Sum of Years and depreciation start date is not in the first period of the fiscal year
validation.description: Year to date depreciation is required if depreciation method is Declining Balance with Switch to Straight Line or Sum of Years and depreciation start date is not in the first period of the fiscal year

validation.validation: Year To Date depreciation cannot be greater than accumulated depreciation
validation.description: Year To Date depreciation cannot be greater than accumulated depreciation

validation.validation: The year to date depreciation entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point
validation.description: The year to date depreciation entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point

validation.validation: Year To Date depreciation cannot be less than accumulated depreciation.

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: Numeric value representing historical bonus depreciation amount. This field  is required if the depreciation schedule has historical information and bonus depreciation percent is populated, else it should be left empty. The value of this field cannot be greater than accumulated depreciation.

validation.validation: Historical bonus depreciation amount must be 0 when accounting treatment is not depreciable capital
validation.description: Historical bonus depreciation amount must be 0 when accounting treatment is not depreciable capital

validation.validation: Historical bonus depreciation amount cannot be greater than accumulated depreciation
validation.description: Historical bonus depreciation amount cannot be greater than accumulated depreciation

validation.validation: Historical bonus depreciation amount is required when bonus depreciation percent has a value and asset depreciation schedule has historical inforamtion
The historical bonus depreciation entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point
validation.description: The historical bonus depreciation entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point

validation.validation: Historical bonus depreciation amount cannot be less than accumulated depreciation.

Document_StatusObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Additional_I.description: A reference to the status of the asset book configuration
A numeric value that represents historical cost balance for depreciation schedule. Historical cost are those transactions with transaction effective date prior to depreciation start date.

validation.validation: The historical cost balance entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point

Asset_Depreciation_Schedule_Data.description: Element containing Asset Depreciation Schedule additional information that will not be updated by updated by Update Asset Depreciation

The date the asset was acquired, or the transaction effective date of the acquisition.

description: Element containing Asset Depreciation Schedule data that may be updated by Update Asset Depreciation Schedule operation.
